Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as bf2522d9bcd7790e170c365b992bedb69c0c8dfb

```
08:19:44 [1mIn meta-facebook/recipes-phosphor/fans/phosphor-fan/poweroffslot.sh line 17:[0m
08:19:44 [0m        echo $output[0m
08:19:44 [32m             ^-----^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.[0m
08:19:44 
08:19:44 [1mDid you mean: [0m
08:19:44         echo "$output"
```
This makes it look like the script powers off _all_ slots.  Can we name the script accordingly?  'power-off-all-slots'?

I would prefer to not have executables with extensions like .sh.  It isn't interesting that it was currently written in shell and makes refactoring to another language more difficult.  Would prefer just 'slot-power-off'.
This program should be installed under /var per https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/anti-patterns.md#incorrect-placement-of-executables-in-sbin-usrsbin-or-bin-usrbin

I apologize for writing /var on the previous patch set.  That is not where this should go based on the document I linked to before.

> Executables of type 1 should not be placed anywhere in ${PATH} because it is confusing and error-prone to users, but should instead be placed in a /usr/libexec/<package> subdirectory.

So that means this should go into /usr/libexec/phosphor-fan/.

`/var/persist` is the overlay file system, which is used for data that is persisted between BMC reboots.  We shouldn't put executables out there.

Np. I misunderstood with /var path. 
Thanks for the clarifications. I will update with '/usr/libexec/phosphor-fan/'

Hi All, 

Could you please review this patch and provide your comments if any. 

Thanks.

Hi All, 

Could you please review this patch and provide your comments if any. 

Thanks.
Why is the one from the phosphor-fan process not being used?  This looks identical to the one in sensor-monitor.service.in in the repository.

Can we make this script generic and use the $OBMC_HOST_INSTANCES?  Then you should be able to support Yv2, Yv3.5, Bletchley, and even Tiogapass from a single script.

In the 'do_install' for this you can add a `sed -i` invocation to update the variable at build time.

These should probably be append-style like:

PACKAGECONFIG:append = " json sensor-monitor"
Based on my comment on line 24, you might need this to be ${PN}-sensor-monitor
Need  ${PN}-sensor monitor?  I don't see any change here.

If we add RDEPENDS:${PN}-sensor-monitor, getting below CI failure.

" QA Issue: /usr/libexec/phosphor-fan-sensor-monitor/host-poweroff contained in package phosphor-fan requires /bin/bash, but no providers found in RDEPENDS:phosphor-fan? [file-rdeps] "

So, Removed in bbappend and added in bb file.

If you are having this problem it is because files are getting installed into phosphor-fan and not phosphor-fan-sensor-monitor.  You must have the wrong FILES directives and/or the recipes is missing a PACKAGE_BEFORE_PN.  I see a PACAKGE_BEFORE_PN in the base recipe, so I think that part is correct.  You'll want to look at your tmp/work/arm.../phosphor-fan/.../packages-split directory to figure out what files went where.  You probably have your new scripts ending up in the wrong package.

I just looked again at the recipe and PACKAGES_BEFORE_PN has "monitor" but not "sensor-monitor".  We likely need sensor-monitor added.  I don't know if you can simply add it to the FAN_PACKAGES variable or not...

Getting below issue when REDEPENDS added with sensor-monitor with below changes in bb file.

RDEPENDS:${PN}-sensor-monitor:append = " bash"

Error :

"/usr/libexec/phosphor-fan-sensor-monitor/host-poweroff contained in package phosphor-fan requires /bin/bash, but no providers found in RDEPENDS:phosphor-fan? "

I have modified the below lines in bb file.

1. {PN}-sensor-monitor added in FAN_PACKAGES (PACKAGES_BEFORE_PN).

FAN_PACKAGES = " \
        ${PN}-presence-tach \
        ${PN}-control \
        ${PN}-monitor \
        ${PN}-sensor-monitor \
"
2. Added sensor-monitor in PACKAGE_CONFIG.

PACKAGECONFIG ?= "presence control monitor sensor-monitor".


Also, checked the path where the script was installed. Below is the installed script path.

build/tmp/work/yosemitev2-openbmc-linux-gnueabi/phosphor-fan/1.0+gitAUTOINC+7d29944b91-r1/packages-split/phosphor-fan/usr/libexec/phosphor-fan-sensor-monitor/host-poweroff.

In target, the script was copied in below path as expected.
/usr/libexec/phosphor-fan-sensor-monitor
You need to add it to the FILES:${PN}-sensor-monitor too, if that is where it belongs.
It seems like much of this content should be in the meta-phosphor layer whenever anyone enables the sensor-monitor PACKAGECONFIG.

I think, this hard poweroff and chassis poweroff is depends of platform specific. Other platforms may not need these *.target files. That is the reason, I am Keeping these files in machine layer. 
Please suggest on this.
You can probably add FILES parts to the base bbfile though.
Which sub-package are you expecting this file to be in?  phosphor-fan-sensor-monitor?  You might need a FILES:${PN}-sensor-monitor directive.
Done. Updated the path with sensor-monitor. The file will be stored in /usr/libexec/phosphor-fan/sensor-monitor.
I don't see any FILES directives that put the content into the ${PN}-sensor-monitor package.
Should this be ${PN}-sensor-monitor?  What is the pattern elsewhere?

One minor typo to remedy.  Also, should there be a Yosemite35 host-poweroff as part of this set since this code would apply there as well...even if it is just a not implemented file as was done for bletchley and Tiogapass?

Agree. This feature can be used for YosemiteV35 as well. Will submit a new patch to configuring it for YV35.

This feature is not implemented as there is no slot concept in Tiogapass. If needed we can poweroff the host alone. we can discuss separately on this.
Should be a space between fan and sensors.
This gets installed via phosphor-state-manager on our systems, so I'd think it would have to be moved into meta-facebook?
ok. These target files are already in the meta-facebook only.

Why is this added here?  Is there anything in the root package that requires bash?

I would have expected in the .bbappend:

RDEPENDS:${PN}-sensor-monitor:append = " bash"

Isn't it only the sensor-monitor part that requires bash and only in the yv2 configuration?
Ack. This bash is needed only for sensor-monitor part. But not only yv2. It's needed for other platforms also.
On our systems, these targets get installed elsewhere, so I think these could just go into the meta-facebook bbappend instead?
Moved these lines to bbappend file.
Is there anything blocking the resolution of Patrick's comments?  At a minimum, Patrick's comments should be ack'd to indicate there is a plan to address them soon.

No blockings as of now. Few comments needs to be resolved. 
Sure. I will ack them.
If you ack the comments, please leave them as unresolved unless there are no changes needed to address the comment.  Please mark the comments as done once the fix(es) have been committed.  Thanks!
Sure. I have marked as unresolved for Acked items.
Have you ran 'shellcheck' on this file?  I see things which I'm surprised were not flagged by CI.
Why do we need to explicitly set these?
Is there any way to make this more readable?  Maybe a function.
Since these are typically supplied by phosphor-state-manager, we need to do something here so that this doesn't get installed on Bletchley.
This should be done in meta-phosphor side.  (some kind of check for sensor-monitor in the PACKAGECONFIG.  bbutils.contains?)

When moving 'FAN_PACKAGES:append = " sensor-monitor"' from bbappend to bb file, getting CI issue in 'p10bmc' ibm platform only.

They added FAN_PACKAGES:append in their bbappend for p10bmc platform.

https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/fans/phosphor-fan_%25.bbappend#L64

You cannot simply move the line to meta-phosphor.  That is not appropriate.  As I wrote before:

> some kind of check for sensor-monitor in the PACKAGECONFIG.  bbutils.contains?

The original FAN_PACKAGES in the base recipe should have something like:

    "${@bb.utils.contains("PACKAGECONFIG", "sensor-monitor", "sensor-monitor")}"

(this is not 100% correct code)

This will make it so whenever the sensor-monitor is added to the PACKAGECONFIG then the FAN_PACKAGES is _automatically_ fixed.  Once that is done you can also remove it from the p10bmc.

What I'm saying is that p10bmc did this in a sloppy way and we should fix it so we are not propagating that sloppiness into our meta-layer also.
Looks like, Some do_fetch failure is causing the CI failure.
You could have retriggered Jenkins then...

Kumar, the parent commit from this is back in November 2021.  I shouldn't have to ask you at this point to rebase these commits resubmitting them.  You should be rebasing your commits every time you push to Gerrit.
Ack. I am rebasing my branch for every push to gerrit.

We also need to support yv3.5 at this point.  Isn't there something we can do to add a base file ("this feature is not implemented") and also add a machine-specific file when appropriate?  Can yv3.5 and yv2 share code?

We need to ensure that yv3.5 at least compiles.

Ack. Base file can be created and file can be shared for fby2 and fby35 if there are difference. Can we add it for fb-compute-multihost ?
 
I will look into this. 

I submitted a separate patch for yv35. 
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/55486.
@Matt, can you take a look at the IBM / meta-phosphor changes now?  I think it is good.
